docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Carlos Tapia is a patient in New York City's Bellevue Hospital Medical Clinic. He encouraged me to write this letter and gave me permission to use his name. Mr. Tapia is 85 years old and has pulmonary tuberculosis. He is not contagious because he takes antibiotics. Without these medications, the tuberculosis in the lining of his lungs would spread and grow in his chest, making it difficult for him to breathe, and ultimately take his life. Though Mr. Tapia is poor and has no medical insurance to pay for his antibiotics, they are provided to him, as to all Bellevue outpatients, by the hospital pharmacy.

headline.main: Closing of Hospital Outpatient Pharmacies Dooms Thousands
